item.title: 司法部反垄断局局长在政府专家组削减成本之际瞄准高价顾问
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一份内部备忘录，美国司法部新确认的反垄断执法部门负责人表示，作为唐纳德-特朗普总统削减联邦政府开支努力的一部分，她所在的部门将审查其在昂贵的经济顾问身上的花费。【原文：The U.S. Department of Justice's newly confirmed head of antitrust enforcement said her division will review what it spends on expensive economic consultants as part of President Donald Trump's effort to cut costs across the federal government, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 美国推动俄乌停火，特朗普和普京有望本周通话
item.description: 美国特使史蒂夫-维特科夫（Steve Witkoff）周日在莫斯科与普京举行了一次他称之为 "积极的 "会谈，结束会谈后告诉美国有线电视新闻网（CNN），美国总统唐纳德-特朗普预计将于本周与俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京就结束乌克兰三年战争的方式进行会谈。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trumpis expected to speak with his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putinthis week on ways to end the three-year war in Ukraine, U.S. envoy Steve Witkoff told CNN on Sunday after returning from what he described as a "positive" meeting with Putin in Moscow.】

item.title: 贝森特说 "不能保证 "美国不会出现经济衰退
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）在接受美国全国广播公司（NBC）周日播出的采访时表示，"不能保证 "美国不会出现经济衰退，但可能会有所调整。【原文：There are "no guarantees" there will not be a recession in the United States but there could be an adjustment, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said in an interview with NBC that aired on Sunday.】

item.title: 人权组织提起诉讼，要求阻止特朗普驱逐支持巴勒斯坦的抗议者
item.description: 美国阿拉伯反歧视委员会（ADC）提起诉讼，质疑特朗普政府驱逐抗议或表示支持巴勒斯坦权利的留学生和学者的行为违宪。【原文：The American-Arab Anti-Discrimination Committee (ADC) filed a lawsuit challenging as unconstitutional the Trump administration’s actions to deport international students and scholars who protest or express support for Palestinian rights.】

item.title: 美国根据现已受阻的授权驱逐数百名被指控的委内瑞拉帮派成员
item.description: 美国国务卿马尔科-鲁比奥（Marco Rubio）周日表示，美国已利用现已被封锁的 1798 年《外敌法案》的授权，驱逐了数百名据称是委内瑞拉帮派特伦德阿拉瓜（Tren de Aragua）的成员。【原文：The United States has removed hundreds of alleged members of the Venezuelan gang Tren de Aragua using now-blocked authority from the 1798 Alien Enemies Act, U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio said on Sunday.】

item.title: 美国根据现已受阻的授权驱逐数百名被指控的委内瑞拉帮派成员
item.description: 美国国务卿马尔科-鲁比奥（Marco Rubio）周日表示，美国已利用现已被封锁的 1798 年《外敌法案》的授权，驱逐了数百名据称是委内瑞拉帮派特伦德阿拉瓜（Tren de Aragua）的成员。【原文：The United States has removed hundreds of alleged members of the Venezuelan gang Tren de Aragua using now-blocked authority from the 1798 Alien Enemies Act, U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio said on Sunday.】

item.title: 共和党人在削减开支和医疗补助问题上意见分歧，同时寻求特朗普减税政策的前进之路
item.description: 国会共和党人面临着推进唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统的减税和边境安全议程的压力，他们在可以从联邦预算中削减多少开支而又不会让依赖社会安全网计划的选民陷入困境的问题上意见不一。【原文：Congressional Republicans, under pressure to move forward on President Donald Trump's tax cut and border security agenda, are at odds over how much spending they can cut from the federal budget without leaving constituents who rely on social safety net programs out in the cold.】

item.title: 洞察力：蟑螂和壁橱里的工作：特朗普复职令的内幕
item.description: 在距离美国国会大厦仅一英里的美国国家航空航天局（NASA）华盛顿总部，据两位熟悉那里情况的人士称，员工们回到总部后发现蟑螂成灾，有些人只能坐在椅子上工作，没有办公桌。【原文：At NASA headquarters in Washington, just a mile from the U.S. Capitol, employees returned to an infestation of cockroaches and some are working in chairs with no desks, according to two people familiar with conditions there.】

item.title: 宇航员机组与空间站对接，取代 "布奇和苏尼
item.description: Crew-10任务是让威尔莫尔和威廉姆斯返回地球的期待已久的第一步。两人计划于美国东部时间周三凌晨4点（格林尼治标准时间8点）离开国际空间站，同行的还有美国国家航空航天局宇航员尼克-黑格和俄罗斯宇航员亚历山大-戈尔布诺夫。【原文：The Crew-10 mission is a long-awaited first step to bring Wilmore and Williams back to Earth. The duo are scheduled to depart the ISS on Wednesday as early as 4 a.m. ET (0800 GMT), along with NASA astronaut Nick Hague and Russian cosmonaut Aleksandr Gorbunov.】

item.title: 在俄罗斯提出抱怨后，特朗普将凯洛格的角色限定为乌克兰特使
item.description: 一些俄罗斯前高级官员抱怨说，在他们看来，凯洛格过于同情基辅。【原文：Some high-ranking former Russian officials have complained that Kellogg was, in their view, too sympathetic to Kyiv.】

item.title: 被拘留的哥伦比亚大学学生的律师要求保释
item.description: 哥伦比亚大学一名学生因支持巴勒斯坦激进主义而被拘留，他的律师在周六的保释动议中辩称，他没有潜逃风险，应获准回家生第一个孩子。【原文：A Columbia University student detained over his pro-Palestinian activism is not a flight risk and should be allowed to return home for the birth of his first child, his lawyers argued in a motion for bail on Saturday.】

item.title: 美国法官以担心战时法律为由提起诉讼，阻止部分驱逐行动
item.description: 在两个非营利组织起诉称唐纳德-特朗普总统可以援引战时法律加速驱逐无证移民后，一名联邦法官周六暂时阻止了美国政府驱逐一些委内瑞拉人。【原文：A federal judge on Saturday temporarily blocked the U.S. government from deporting some Venezuelans after two non-profit groups sued saying President Donald Trump could invoke a wartime law to accelerate deportations of undocumented migrants.】

item.title: 白宫：特朗普签署预算拨款法案使其成为法律
item.description: 白宫在一份声明中说，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周六签署了国会本周通过的一项临时支出法案，避免了政府部分停摆。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Saturday signed a stopgap spending bill, passed by Congress this week, that averts a partial government shutdown, the White House said in a statement.】

item.title: 白宫撤回人质问题特使提名
item.description: 白宫周六表示，特朗普政府已撤回对亚当-博勒（Adam Boehler）担任人质事务总统特使的提名。【原文：The Trump administration has withdrawn the nomination of Adam Boehler to serve as special presidential envoy for hostage affairs, the White House said on Saturday.】

item.title: 龙卷风袭击美国南部造成三人死亡，风险不断上升
item.description: 密苏里州警方表示，一系列龙卷风一夜之间袭击了美国中西部和东南部地区，造成三人死亡。【原文：Three people were killed in Missouri as a series of tornadoes hit the U.S. Midwest and southeast overnight, raking a path of destruction that was still being assessed early on Saturday, police said.】

item.title: 特朗普签署命令撤消美国之音和其他机构的职能
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周五签署了一项行政命令，旨在削减美国政府资助的媒体机构美国之音的母公司和其他六个联邦机构，这是他的政府为缩减官僚机构而采取的最新举措。【原文：President Donald Trump signed an executive order on Friday aimed at gutting the parent of U.S. government-funded media outlet Voice of America and six other federal agencies, his administration's latest step to shrink bureaucracy.】

item.title: 特朗普暂停保罗-魏斯律师事务所人员的安全许可
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周五签署了一项行政命令，暂停纽约律师事务所 Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison 员工的安全许可。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump signed an executive order on Friday suspending security clearances held by people at New York law firm Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison.】

item.title: 备忘录称，特朗普政府正在权衡对数十个国家的旅行禁令
item.description: 据熟悉内情的消息人士和路透社看到的一份内部备忘录称，作为新禁令的一部分，特朗普政府正在考虑对数十个国家的公民实施全面的旅行限制。【原文：The Trump administration is considering issuing sweeping travel restrictions for the citizens of dozens of countries as part of a new ban, according to sources familiar with the matter and an internal memo seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局将提出允许扩大无人机使用范围的规则
item.description: 美国运输部长肖恩-达菲（Sean Duffy）周五表示，联邦航空管理局计划提出扩大使用无人机送货和提供其他服务的规则。【原文：U.S. Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said on Friday that the Federal Aviation Administration plans to propose rules to expand use of drones for deliveries and other services.】

item.title: 实时更新：美国国家航空航天局（NASA）和太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）将发射火箭将被困宇航员送回家
item.description: 美国航天局和 SpaceX 公司正在执行一项任务，将宇航员布奇-威尔莫尔和苏尼-威廉姆斯带回家。他们已经被困在国际空间站九个月了。【原文：The U.S. space agency and SpaceX are on a mission to bring home astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams. They have been stuck on the International Space Station for nine months.】

item.title: 美国法院允许特朗普暂时执行对可持续发展教育项目的禁令
item.description: 美国一家上诉法院周五暂时中止了法官的一项裁决，该裁决曾阻止唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府在联邦机构和与联邦政府签订合同的企业中实施有关多元化、公平和包容计划的禁令。【原文：A U.S. appeals court on Friday temporarily paused a judge's ruling that had blocked the administration of President Donald Trump from implementing bans on diversity, equity and inclusion programs at federal agencies and businesses that contract with the federal government.】

item.title: 美国参议院政府支出法案获得通过
item.description: 在足够多的少数派民主党人与多数派共和党人联合支持之后，美国参议院周五似乎将推进一项法案，以防止政府部分关门。【原文：The U.S. Senate on Friday looked set to advance a bill that would prevent a partial government shutdown, after a sufficient number of minority Democrats joined with the majority Republicans in support.】

item.title: 美国副总统万斯告诉 NBC 新闻，他希望在 4 月 5 日前达成 "高水平 "的 TikTok 协议
item.description: 美国副总统 JD Vance 周五表示，他希望在 4 月 5 日最后期限之前达成 "高水平 "的 TikTok 协议。【原文：U.S. Vice President JD Vance said on Friday he expects a "high level" TikTok deal by the April 5 deadline.】

item.title: 特朗普在司法部讲话中要求对追捕他的人 "问责
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统周五在美国司法部发表讲话，誓言要追究那些在他下台后的几年里对他穷追猛打的人的责任。【原文：President Donald Trump on Friday vowed to seek accountability for those who pursued him during his years out of power, speaking at the U.S. Justice Department whose prosecutors had brought some of those cases.】

item.title: 鉴于任务繁忙，NASA获得额外一周时间提交大规模裁员计划
item.description: 美国国家航空航天局（NASA）周五表示，鉴于该机构本月要处理的高度优先太空任务数量众多，该机构向美国最高人事机构提交大规模裁员计划的截止日期被延长了一周。【原文：NASA on Friday said it received a one-week deadline extension to submit its plans for mass layoffs to the top U.S. personnel agency, given the number of high-priority space missions the agency is grappling with this month.】

item.title: 美国司法部官员称哥伦比亚战争抗议活动违反恐怖主义规定
item.description: 美国司法部副部长托德-布兰奇（Todd Blanche）周五表示，司法部正在审查哥伦比亚大学学生就加沙战争举行的抗议活动是否违反了联邦恐怖主义法。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department is examining whether student protests at Columbia University over the Gaza war violated federal terrorism laws, Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche said on Friday.】

item.title: 加巴德承诺 "积极追究 "美国情报机构的泄密行为
item.description: 美国国家情报总监图尔西-加巴德（Tulsi Gabbard）承诺将严厉打击情报界向记者泄露信息的行为。【原文：U.S. Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard has pledged to crack down on people within the intelligence community who leak information to journalists.】

item.title: 巴尔的摩市要求停止美国联邦储蓄委员会资金冻结的申请被法官驳回
item.description: 巴尔的摩市的一名联邦法官周五驳回了该市要求暂时阻止消费者金融保护局清空其储备金并将资金返还给美国联邦储备局或财政部的努力。【原文：A federal judge in Baltimore on Friday rejected the city's effort to temporarily block the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau from emptying its reserves and returning the money to the U.S. Federal Reserve or Department of the Treasury.】

item.title: 卢比奥称美国将在未来几天撤销更多学生签证
item.description: 继哥伦比亚大学学生马哈茂德-哈利勒（Mahmoud Khalil）被捕并被拘留之后，美国国务卿马可-鲁比奥（Marco Rubio）周五表示，美国很可能在未来几天撤销更多学生的签证。【原文：The United States will likely revoke visas of more students in the coming days, U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio said on Friday, following the arrest and detention of Columbia University student Mahmoud Khalil, whom the Trump administration aims to deport over his pro-Palestinian activism.】

item.title: 民主党人针对共和党选区开展反对特朗普削减开支的市政厅活动
item.description: 民主党人计划在目前由共和党人把持的竞争激烈的美国众议院选区举行一系列市民大会，旨在利用人们对唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统大力削减联邦政府的愤怒情绪。【原文：Democrats plan a series of town hall meetings in highly competitive U.S. House of Representatives districts currently held by Republicans, aiming to tap into anger over President Donald Trump's campaign to aggressively slash the federal government.】
